name: Vegan Fresh Spring Rolls with Peanut Sauce
description: Easy Vegan Fresh Spring Rolls with Peanut Sauce. Rice paper Fresh Rolls with Marinated Tofu and Peanut Dipping Sauce. Gluten-free Recipe. Can be Nutfree with Sunbutter or Sweet Chili sauce.

video.name: VEGAN SPRING ROLLS WITH PEANUT SAUCE RECIPE | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Vegan Spring Rolls with Peanut Sauce Recipe

Get the WRITTEN RECIPE here - https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-fresh-spring-rolls-with-peanut-sauce/

SUBSCRIBE HERE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

Easy Vegan Fresh Spring Rolls with Peanut Sauce. Rice paper Fresh Rolls with Marinated Tofu and Peanut Dipping Sauce.

These refreshing fresh rolls are perfect for the warm weather. Tofu is marinated in a simple marinade, noodles are cooked and tossed with some peanut sauce, veggies are sliced or julienned, the fresh herbs such as mint and cilantro, chopped up, rice paper wrappers assembled and then stuff and roll.

Change it up by changing the marinade, add in fruit, change up the dipping sauce to my sweet chili sauce.

******MORE SPRING DISHES FROM THE BLOG******

recipeIngredient: 8 oz firm Tofu pressed for atleast 10 mins to remove excess moisture, then sliced thin
2 tbsp soy sauce or use tamari for glutenfree
4 oz brown rice pad thai noodles (or 6 oz vermicelli/mai fun noodles cooked according to instruction on the package)
1 cup julienned or thinly sliced carrots
1 cup julienned or thinly sliced cucumber or zucchini

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the marinade ingredients until well combined. Slice the Tofu into thin rectangles and add to the bowl. (For variation, add 2 tsp sambal oelek or asian chile sauce, or chinese 5 spice.) Toss lightly. Chill for about an hour. (You can also bake the marinated tofu for 20 to 25 mins at 350 deg F(180C).)
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the marinade ingredients until well combined. Slice the Tofu into thin rectangles and add to the bowl. (For variation, add 2 tsp sambal oelek or asian chile sauce, or chinese 5 spice.) Toss lightly. Chill for about an hour. (You can also bake the marinated tofu for 20 to 25 mins at 350 deg F(180C).)

recipeInstructions.text: Make your dipping sauce and set aside. Cook the noodles, drain and add to a bowl. Mix in 2 tbsp of the dipping sauce and toss well. (use 1 tbsp if using sweet chile lime sauce)
recipeInstructions.name: Make your dipping sauce and set aside. Cook the noodles, drain and add to a bowl. Mix in 2 tbsp of the dipping sauce and toss well. (use 1 tbsp if using sweet chile lime sauce)

recipeInstructions.text: Prep your workstation with a large shallow bowl of warm water and a clean surface.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep your workstation with a large shallow bowl of warm water and a clean surface.

recipeInstructions.text: Dip rice paper wrapper in the shallow bowl for 30 seconds to a minute until softened. Transfer to the clean surface.
recipeInstructions.name: Dip rice paper wrapper in the shallow bowl for 30 seconds to a minute until softened. Transfer to the clean surface.

recipeInstructions.text: Arrange the layers on the wrappers. I start with some mint or basil on the third line of the wrapper, then tofu, then some julienned veggies and noodles in front, then some cilantro or mint.
recipeInstructions.name: Arrange the layers on the wrappers. I start with some mint or basil on the third line of the wrapper, then tofu, then some julienned veggies and noodles in front, then some cilantro or mint.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold the rice paper wrapper from the bottom over the filling. Then fold in the sides, then continue to roll the bottom towards to the top keeping it tight. Seal and place on a serving plate. Cover with a damp towel until ready to serve. Serve with dipping sauce of choice
recipeInstructions.name: Fold the rice paper wrapper from the bottom over the filling. Then fold in the sides, then continue to roll the bottom towards to the top keeping it tight. Seal and place on a serving plate. Cover with a damp towel until ready to serve. Serve with dipping sauce of choice

keywords: fresh rolls, fresh summer rolls, rice paper rolls, summer rolls, vietnamese spring rolls
